hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via 20D Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and price consolidates within ±5% of 20DMA for 7+ days, a breakout above the consolidation high on >1.5x average volume signals transition to BULL regime with 85% probability of 8%+ continuation over next 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low-volatility consolidation in neutral regimes represents energy accumulation. Breakouts on elevated volume signal institutional accumulation and regime transition initiation. The 8% target aligns with typical initial impulse waves during regime shifts.
entry_conditions: BTC price within ±5% of 20DMA for 7+ consecutive days
BTC breaks above consolidation high (7-day range) on volume >1.5x 20D average
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If breakout occurs but price fails to sustain >3% above breakout level for 48 hours, or if >60% of similar historical signals (2019-2024) show mean return <4% over 5 days.
